revised_title: A Generalized Spatial-Temporal Model of Rainfall Based on a Clustered Point Process
tldr: This article presents a simple stochastic spatial-temporal model of rainfall that incorporates a clustered point process for the arrival times of rain cells. The model allows for the correlation of rain cell parameters, such as intensity and duration, and can be used to fit second-order properties taken from time-series records. The model is useful for hydrological studies that require long records of multi-site rainfall data.
